qas.question: When did the most catastrophic earthquakes occur?
How many residential buildings did not meet construction standards?
How often do earthquakes that lead to serious loss of life occur?

context: The most catastrophic earthquakes we know of occurred in <a0_0>31 BCE, 363, 749, and 1033 CE<a0_0/>, that is every ca. 400 years on average. Destructive earthquakes leading to serious loss of life strike about <a2_0>every 80 years<a2_0/>. While stringent construction regulations are currently in place and recently built structures are earthquake-safe, as of 2007[update] the majority of the buildings in Israel were older than these regulations and many public buildings as well as <a1_0>50,000<a1_0/> residential buildings did not meet the new standards and were "expected to collapse" if exposed to a strong quake. Given the fragile political situation of the Middle East region and the presence there of major holy sites, a quake reaching magnitude 7 on the Richter scale could have dire consequences for world peace.
